summary: Build a professional website to sell Binance Gift Cards (USDT values $500–$50,000) and accept payments in Bitcoin.
architectural_notes: Introduce a configurable pricing multiplier/discount (e.g., 0.5) used when calculating the BTC amount shown in payment instructions.
Add owner-only access control for the admin panel (authentication + authorization).
known_issues: Checkout flow bug: clicking 'Create order' / 'Get payment instructions' does not display Bitcoin payment instructions (e.g., BTC address/payment details) to the user.

existing_features.title: Create a responsive, professional marketing + storefront experience for selling Binance Gift Cards with fixed USDT denominations from $500 up to $50,000.
Implement a product catalog UI that lets users browse and select a gift card denomination and quantity, and calculates totals in USDT.
Implement a checkout flow that collects buyer contact details and presents Bitcoin payment instructions (Bitcoin payment acceptance) for the order.
Add a minimal admin screen (no external auth required) to review orders and update order status manually (e.g., mark as Paid/Delivered) after verifying Bitcoin payment off-app.
Apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme for a professional crypto storefront (avoid blue/purple), including consistent color palette, typography, button styles, and section layouts.
Add generated static image assets and render them in the UI from frontend/public/assets/generated (do not serve images via the backend).
Fix the Checkout page so Bitcoin payment instructions reliably display immediately after a successful "Create Order & Get Payment Instructions" submission, even after the cart session is cleared.
Add clear error feedback when order creation fails (including when the backend actor is not initialized), ensuring users understand why payment instructions are not shown.

Apply a global 50% pricing rule so that the amount shown in Bitcoin payment instructions reflects half of the selected gift card USDT total (e.g., a $500 card charges $250 worth of BTC), consistently across Checkout success view and the Order Status page for pending-payment orders.

Restrict Admin Panel access so only the site owner can access admin routes and admin backend operations (listing all orders and updating order status). Use Internet Identity for owner authentication/authorization and show an English “Access denied” experience to non-owners.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a professional e-commerce website for selling Binance Gift Cards (USDT denominations $500–$50,000) with Bitcoin payment acceptance.
Create backend order storage and basic order status tracking (e.g., Pending Payment, Paid, Delivered, Cancelled) in the single Motoko main actor.
Apply a 50% pricing rule so Bitcoin payment instructions show half of the selected gift card’s USDT value (e.g., $500 card charges $250 equivalent in BTC) for all denominations.
Restrict Admin Panel access to owner-only (add authentication/authorization so only the site owner can access admin features).

projectName: Professional website to sell Binance Gift Cards (USDT $500–$50,000) with Bitcoin payments
